header.title: The best fence installation company in Sunnyvale
bullets: Fast, responsive and friendly customer service from start to finish.
FREE custom fence quotes that you can create and review online!
Transparent pricing so you know exactly what you’re getting.
Quality fence craftsmanship delivered by skilled contractors.

Yelp.description: I am very impressed with Ergeon. They were absolutely perfect with everything. Showed up on time, quality of work was beautiful, cleaned up after themselves. I would definitely recommend them to everyone because their quality of work speaks for themselves. Not to mention that the project manager, Alan, is always on top of everything. Every time I had a question I would call or text and he would have an answer or make sure he would take care of all my needs . You will not be disappointed with Ergeon.
Yelp.name: Jackie V.
Yelp.title: They showed up on time,  cleaned up after themselves and the quality of work was beautiful,

Google.description: Ergeon removed an existing 72’ wood fence and replaced with a new one. The fence is well constructed and quite attractive. The cost was very competitive with a number of other bids I received. All of the Ergeon personnel with whom I dealt with were professional and friendly. I would strongly recommend hiring Ergeon for any fence construction project.
Google.name: Richard N.
Google.title: All of the Ergeon personnel with whom I dealt with were professional and friendly.

regulations.title: Permits & Regulations
regulations.description: See the undefined Permits & Regulations for undefined

faq.setback: 7 feet tall fence must be set back 2 feet from the property line on street side yard
faq.corner-lot-rules: Max 3.5 height on 40 feet visibility Triangle area. Unless is an "open fence" .  Open fence means a fence up to 4.5  feet tall with posts spaced at least eight feet apart. Fence between 3.5 and 4.5 feet must be no more than 50% open. Posts or other decorations cannot exceed twelve inches in width or thickness

articles.description: If you’re looking to get a new fence in California, it’s important to know about the laws surrounding fences and home improvement projects. Our post will go over some important things to keep in mind.

When it’s time to get a new fence it’s important to always use a reputable, licensed, and insured contractor. Some people try to cut costs by using unlicensed contractors, but this can end up being a major issue if any problems happen during the installation or down the line. In this post, we’ll go over the main reasons why you should always use a licensed and insured fence contractor.

There’s a lot to consider when weighing the pros and cons of a wood fence versus a chain link fence. We’ve tried to make the process easier for you by diving deeper into some of the areas of consideration.
